title: Second row may or may not show up
comment: I enabled the second row. Sometimes it's there, sometimes it's gone. I use around 10 apps daily so a second row is really needed so that I don't have 10 icons squeezed in one row. I could have tone it down to show 5 apps per row but without the second row to show the remaining 5 apps it would defeat the purpose of wanting to have the most convenient access to my 10 frequently used apps. Please look into this bug (if it's actually a bug) or tell me if I configured it incorrectly.

title: Just what I was looking for
comment: Easy way to have quick access to my most used applications. Can't find anything wrong with it works perfect

title: Awesome!
comment: After my SG5 got Lollipop it stopped working, but when it does work it is awesome! Edit: Got it fixed due to good customer support!

Hi Robert, make sure Hangar is added to Settings -> Security -> Apps with usage access (bottom).  Samsung did something to the settings intent (ie. it's broken) and that's why you get the error when Hangar tries to launch the settings page.  I need to put in a warning/work around for SGS5 users.

Hope that helps!  Cheers

title: Was Great
comment: I loved this app and it worked great, however since updating to Lollipop on my Verizon branded Galaxy S5, it no longer works. I Uninstalled and reinstalled the app, but every time I try to give it permission like it asks for, it stops responding and shuts down. *EDIT* After following the authors instructions, the app works flawlessly and is again one of my favorite apps.

Hi Robert, make sure Hangar is added to Settings -> Security -> Apps with usage access (bottom).  Samsung did something to the settings intent (ie. it's broken) and that's why you get the error when Hangar tries to launch the settings page.  I need to put in a warning/work around for SGS5 users.

Hope that helps!  Cheers
Nice

title: Fast app access
comment: Only thing I don't like is that you can't take the icon off the status bar unless you pay them.

This is not the case at all.  In Android 4.4 and below it's a limitation of Android itself where ongoing notifications -must- have an icon.  In Android 5.0+ however the icon is gone.  That said, there are ways of removing the icon in Android 4.4 if you set the priority to Bottom.  Hangar is also completely free!

That's no good!  There are a few ways we can figure out your issue.  1) Reinstall the app 2) Join the G+ group and try beta builds to narrow down the issue or 3) Report the crash when it happens.

Hope things get fixed with #1 but if not the G+ community is here to help!

Good news, this is a feature!  In the Apps section click on an app and Pin that app.  It'll be pinned and always shown in the notification drawer (or apps widget).

title: Had to remove
comment: When I installed this,  my "ok google" command from every screen  stopped working.  I couldn't figure it out for awhile,  but as soon as I uninstalled this app,  it started working again. (Note 2) that's too bad cause I liked this app otherwise.

Nancy this is unfortunate and quite frankly I'm baffled by it.  Hangar simply doesn't have the permission/ability to interfere with something on a system level such as voice command listening.

I'd urge you to try the new version, but I'm honestly at a loss as to how Hangar could cause such an issue.

Right now there's a solution in the works to use Xposed to remove it, but it's a limitation of Android and unavoidable for developers (even with root).

title: Awesome
comment: So far so good

title: Almost perfect!
comment: Simple yet versatile! If only there was a drag & drop option to rearrange the app icons. Pinning the app and changing the order with 'Pinned app sorting' option is all good and stuff, however it would be much more easier to have a drag & drop option. Also, it'll be great to have all apps listed in Hangar rather than limiting them to the ones that is frequently used. Divider is a bit rectangle-ish, a more square design will make it look more presentable.

title: Will be higher rated once I get a reply
comment: So on my Nexus 5, it's only letting me pick some apps, and not all the ones I have. Why is that? Does the app currently only support some apps, and not all?

Like somewhat mentioned in the Instructions, Hangar takes a few days to pick up a decent amount of app activity to work most effectively.

The short answer though is that Hangar only monitors apps running in the foreground.  If you haven't launched the app it won't be listed in Hangar until you do.

Hope that helps.

title: A few bits missing... So nearly perfect...
comment: Hellooooo first big thanks and well done,    I would like to see,  a way to re arrange my apps on the top I have pinned 5 apps but I dont like the order they appear in.    Thank you

There are numerous ways pinned apps can be sorted.  Check the preferences!  If you want them ordered by the order YOU pin them you can do that to get very specific.  Otherwise it uses sorting algorithms.

title: Loving it so far
comment: Only just downloaded and already becoming on of my most used apps

I really can't find a good use for this app. All it is is relocating your most used apps so you can see your wallpaper a bit better, but it removes the instantaneous access to the apps I have on my home screen(the apps I use the most, duh!). I have to pull down the banner and then tap. This takes too long. Isn't it the same as opening you app drawer?

I'm sorry this app was forced on you. I'm perfectly fine with the fact that it won't be useful to certain people. Maybe take into consideration that there are other users who DO find a use for Hangar and that it is a completely free and open source app developed completely in the author's spare time as a hobby.
Loved the concept. Loved the implementation. Nice app with a nice widget.

title: Great for a minimalist design
comment: With this app, I can display any picture on my home screen with only my app drawer icon to cover up any of it. I am old enough, though, to pin my phone and SMS app to the front. Great app!

comment: What a fabulous & well implemented No Brainer of an idea.
Excellent app. Has enabled me to clear my launcher home page of many apps with on touch access to my most used apps
perfect

title: Battery eater!!
comment: S**ks battery big time!!! Please fix it. Otherwise deserves 5* !!!

This is not true *at all*.  Extensive testing has been done for months and the amount it uses is too small to have any real impact.  The app does *not* hold wakelock and only runs when your phone is on while you're using other apps. Consult the FAQ for more details please.

title: Perfect...

title: Love it!
comment: So elegant, simple, versatile, customizable, and feature-rich! Why is this not featured on Google Play Store!
Reinstalling fixed the problem. The app usually fails to show up in status bar after updates. This has been a problem for previous versions.

Updated response:  You have to re-launch the app after it gets updated since Android kills the service.  Is that the issue?  Let me know please, I'm very interested in squashing bugs!  G+ community is the best way to grab beta updates and help test.  It's much appreciated, thanks!

title: It looks great but
comment: It doesn't always update for me. The app icons shown don't always reflect the apps that I have most recently been using. Galaxy Note 3 running android 4.3.

That's not really how Hangar works.  It uses a combination of recently added apps, time spent in app, # of launches, etc.  If you want it to just reflect your most recently used apps, turn off the weight sorting.
Thanks Jeff for responding I have joined g+ community.When I changed number of icons displayed the app crashing got resolved. I love this app . Good solution to app switching with recent apps widget.

Please join the G+ community and opt into a beta release.  The bug may be fixed but at the very least you'll have access to beta builds which can report a lot helpful debugging information (should you select Report after a crash).  I'm always looking to fix bugs, especially ones I can't reproduce myself!

title: Just what I was looking for.

title: I joined the beta trial
comment: All I can say is this application does as it says. I've been testing and testing; every tiny issue I had was fixed in the first update? Since that point all has been perfect. I would like to see the ability to pin specific apps. If it has been addedd to this release, I'm editing this post and rating 5 stars! Edit: 5 stars, I very rarely rate apps 5 stars. Thanks man
Released today and you can definitely pin apps now!  Go grab the new version and thank you for being a beta tester
Love this customization !
Apparently as good as it gets

Hey Jason, as much as I'd like this to be possible, it's simply not -- it's literally part of the Android OS framework.  Apps do not do this.  Even power toggles admits as such in their FAQ: http://powertoggles.com/help/?e=15

That said, I'm sure there are some custom ROMs let you suppress ongoing statusbar icons.
Pretty convenient. I really like the ability to see your usage.

title: I like it :)
comment: It's on my phone, but won't run on my tablet due to it being android 4.0 (not compatible) Will be cool when icon packs are supported. Maybe it should be in the "pro" version.  4 start +1 for the future icon pack support :)  Thanks for the reply Jeff

Icon pack support is actually in beta testing right now on G+!  Which tablet do you have?  It should run on all devices running Android 4.1+.  Any devices below that version are simply incompatible with the enhanced notification builder Hangar uses and unfortunately nothing can be done for them.

title: Shows All Usage
comment: I mainly use this to track usage of apps on my device and it does a great job of that. It will only track usage when app is upfront. Would give 5 stars if it tracked usage of background running apps such as media playing apps (Google Play Music, Podkicker, etc..). Keep it up!

comment: The apps widget is particularly useful. Would like to be able to use icon sets to match it to the rest of my phone's look, but otherwise very good.

title: Looks great so far!
comment: Update: can't reproduce the problem so .. maybe just me glitching something?  Minor bug: if you set icon tinting then turn it off the previous tint setting remains. In order to remove tinting you have to manually reset it to white. (Note3)

Hi Trevor, I can't reproduce that issue on my end. Would you mind shooting me a quick email with any details that could help me look into it for you? (notification or widget, etc). 

Thanks!
Excellent app working well on my Samsung Note 3.

title: Its really good!
comment: Dont crash , uses minimal amount of ram…  why not give it 5 stars! This app deserves it.

title: VeRy useful in s4
comment: So neat and easy to use

title: Useful!
comment: Good job.

title: Good work
comment: Nice idea though!
Easy to access..

title: Handy & useful.
comment: Provides a quick and easy access to most used apps.

title: Ingenious
comment: Clever little thing. Allows you to keep your home screen free of apps if you're anal about those things.

title: Good concept
comment: Might not the prettiest execution but works as required!

title: Love it!
comment: Personally, I'm not a fan of using tons of screens for apps and widgets. I just keep all of my app folders tucked neatly inside my app drawer where everything is a few clicks away. With Hangar, now all of my most used apps are even easier to access, without cluttering up my screen.

title: Works great!
comment: Does everything that you need it to do. Very helpful if you are like me and constantly pulling down the notification drawer. Only thing I would recommend is the ability to not have the status bar icon while keeping it at the top of the notification list.

title: awesome!
comment: I have, however, a small request: is it possible to add icon pack support? because the widget and the notification look kind of off when I'm using one on my launcher. thanks in advance! great work!

title: Almost perfect
comment: Would be absolutely perfect if there were an option to remove the icon on the status bar while keeping it in the notification pull down.   Many people dislike persistent icons in the status bar.

You can change the icon (including making it transparent) in appearance. However, due to the limitations of Android the priority will be dropped to bottom of the drawer if you toggle off the icon. I do what I can but some things are out of my control :(

title: very good work...keep it up
comment: loved the app...it works awesome

title: Awww yiss!
comment: I've been waiting for this app since forever.  Thanks. Could you guys make a chrome extension that sorts the bookmarks on the bookmarks bar like this app? :)

title: This will become my new fav app
comment: Recently upgraded to S5 and home screen short cuts have been removed, so this is a good replacement. Plus just generally useful when changing between apps while browsing. Excellent stuff.

title: Awesome
comment: This completes my mobile workflow

title: Needs to support icon packs
comment: Works well enough but doesn't look good on homescreen since it uses original icons and I have icon pack in use everywhere else on my device.
Support for icon packs is one of the features in the development roadmap

title: Great App
comment: Awesome app, is there a way to add a little more weight to some apps?, Also would love some sort of time based, where I could program a work, non work hours and have separate sets of apps depending on usage during those times.

Check out the google+ group to get in on beta testing and discussion of new features.  Profiles (to whitelist/blacklist apps, switchable through Tasker) is actually the next planned feature and is currently under development. It'll also let you pin apps to the shortcut row itself.

title: This and powertoggles
comment: Just supercharges your notification bar... Hoping it just gets better with time :)
Amazing App

title: What a brilliant idea
comment: All that space in the notification area was going to waste. Now I can clean up my home screen of icons. Thank you!

title: Fantastic
comment: Great stylish app, low resource usage, virtually no bugs. What more could you ask for? Recommended.

Unfortunately I can't reproduce this on my end.  Have you tried going to the Behavior tab after setting No notification icon (in the Appearance tab) and changing the priority there?  You can email me, join the G+ community or post in the XDA thread if you'd like to further discuss and resolve this issue.
Very good.

title: Great
comment: Found it on xda feeds and after trying it out, I am satisfied

title: Great
comment: Best Free Open Source as well

title: Works like it is supposed to
comment: Works amazing but I really want to know you you have a permanent brightness slider in a aosp based rom? I have been looking for one forever, the status bar slider is to unreliable, especially for my screen size and high edged case (OtterBox) Is it a custom ROM you are using?
That screenshot is actually from SlimBean 4.3.  The new versions of SlimKat (4.4) do not have it, though it may be something in the near future that's added (I'm also a SlimRoms dev).

title: Good Job!
comment: Keep those useful updates rollin' :)

title: Loved It!!
comment: I was in search for this kind of an app since some time, and I'll have to admit, my search ends today!!
Great app by a great dev

title: Whitelist needed
comment: A whitelist would be just as useful as the blacklist.
Something along these lines will be introduced in the next major feature addition (profiles). Check out the description for the link! Cheers

title: Useful shortcuts!
comment: After a couple days of using hangar, I can't imagine not having its intelligent shortcuts in my notification drawer. Great feature! My only problem with the app is being forced to see the horrifying number of hours I spend on my device playing plants vs zombies. Can't wait to see what this dev comes up with next!

title: Great idea and we'll executed!
comment: Wasn't quite what I thought it was when I downloaded it but it is pretty cool. I was hoping it would replace my other  notification app but it probably won't. I'll keep it around and see how it learns my favs. Thanks!
